migration_bengaluru_2024_25.source: Projected from PLFS 2020-21, CBRE Tech Talent 2025, ILO India Employment Report 2024, Research studies on Bengaluru migration
migration_bengaluru_2024_25.note: Bengaluru as IT/education hub shows employment-dominated migration pattern
migration_bengaluru_2024_25.methodology: Projections based on urban migration patterns, Bengaluru's IT sector growth (12% 2018-2023), 1M+ tech workforce, and position as education hub with 3.7M students in Karnataka

key_trends: Work/employment migration increased from 35% to 52% - driven by IT sector boom
Education migration increased from 12% to 18% - Karnataka hosts 3.7 million migrant students
Marriage-based migration declined from 25% to 15% in urban Bengaluru
IT sector accounts for 1M+ tech workers, growing at 12% (2018-2023)
Bengaluru crossed 1 million tech workforce milestone in 2024
